Title: Provides that an employer shall not be liable for unemployment benefits for an employee who voluntarily leaves employment
Summary: Provides that an employer's account for unemployment insurance coverage shall not be charged when an employee quits without good cause, regardless of whether the former employee has filed and been disqualified for benefits and later files and qualifies for unemployment insurance based on subsequent employment.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the labor law, in relation to limiting the liability of certain employers for unemployment insurance coverage
